snippet: Greg Smith’s resignation is bringing new attention to Wall Street’s culture, which he decried in an open diatribe.
abstract: Greg Smith’s resignation from Goldman Sachs is bringing new attention to Wall Street’s culture, which he decried in an Op-Ed article in The New York Times; it could re-ignite public suspicion that Wall Street's clients are not first in priority but last; even bankers who disagree with Smith say article strikes a chord because it stirs up their own doubts, especially in the wake of the financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: Greg Smith’s resignation is bringing new attention to Wall Street’s culture, which he decried in an open diatribe.

headline.main: Public Exit From Goldman Raises Doubt Over a New Ethic
headline.print_headline: Public Exit From Goldman Raises Doubt Over a New Ethic
